titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Department of Athletics, Yale University, Records Documenting Crew
Department of Athletics, Yale University, Records Documenting Crew
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 5, 2019 at 08:00

did.unittitle: Department of Athletics, Yale University, records documenting crew

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of logbooks, scrapbooks, correspondence, profiles, and ephemera of the Yale crew team. Also included is a memoir of Archie Monroe Quarrier who, as a member of the Yale crew team, participated in the 1924 Olympics in Paris.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 38-B (YRG 38-B), Records documenting specific sports at Yale.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Crew scrapbooks, 1916-1935 are available on microfilm from Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, at cost. Order no. HM162. 1983 and 1985. 4389 frames on 5 reels, 35mm. Crew logbook, 1881-1905 is available on microfilm from Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, at cost. Order no. HM163. 1983. 393 frames on 1 reel, 35mm. Logbook of freshman crew, 1893 (along with boat club records) is also available on microfilm (230 frames on 1 reel, 35mm.) from Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, at cost. Order no. HM161. Logbook of the Yale crew, 1903-1938 is also available on microfilm (381 frames on 1 reel, 35mm.) from Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, at cost. Order no. HM79.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The records are partially restricted. See inventory for details.
The captain of the crew team is allowed to use the logbooks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The majority of scrapbooks have been microfilmed. Patrons must use HM FILM 162 instead of the originals. Original phonodiscs may not be played. Researchers must consult with the reference archivist for policies and procedures governing the creation of duplicating master and use copies of original items.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Department of Athletics, Yale University, Records Documenting Crew (RU 121). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of logbooks, scrapbooks, correspondence, profiles, and ephemera of the Yale crew team. Also included is a memoir of Archie Monroe Quarrier who, as a member of the Yale crew team, participated in the 1924 Olympics in Paris.

did.unittitle: Men's crew team logbooks and memorabilia

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Records of the men's crew team and boat club
Records of the men's crew team and boat club
Hoyt Pease's records of the Yale-Harvard Regatta committee
Men's crew team captain's log book
Silk banner commemorating the Yale crew team's victory over Harvard
Silk banner commemorating the Yale crew team's victory over Harvard
History of the 1952 heavyweight crew team
History of the 1952 heavyweight crew team
Highlights from dinner in honor of Yale's Olympic crew team and Ivy League Championship Football team [sound recording]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

did.unittitle: Highlights from dinner in honor of Yale's Olympic crew team and Ivy League Championship Football team held at the Waldorf Astoria, NY, phonodisc (LP)
Scrapbooks of the men's crew team

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Scrapbooks are partially available on microfilm. Patrons must use HM FILM 162 instead of the originals where a microfilm reel number is listed.
